title: Honoring Kenneth D. Pasternak upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Spirit of the Catskills Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Kenneth D. Pasternak upon the occasion
of his designation as recipient of the Spirit of the Catskills Award  by
the Coalition to Save Belleayre

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Kenneth D. Pasternak has given not only of his time and ener-
gies but also of his competence, intelligence and leadership and  conse-
quently has been designated for special recognition; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor Kenneth D.
Pasternak upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Spir-
it of the Catskills Award by the Coalition to Save Belleayre at its 25th
Annual Snowball to be held on Saturday, January 29, 2011,  at  Belleayre
Mountain, Highmount, New York; and
  WHEREAS,  Kenneth  D.  Pasternak, a lifelong presence in Fleischmanns,
was chosen as the recipient of this auspicious award for his  commitment
to  improving the quality of life and economic vitality for everyone who
lives in, works in and visits that part of the Catskill Region; and
  WHEREAS, Kenneth D. Pasternak attended the Fleischmanns Central School
from Kindergarten  until  high  school  when  Fleischmanns  merged  with
Margaretville  Central  School,  from  which he graduated in 1972; after
earning a Bachelor of Arts degree in Education from the State University
of New York at New Paltz, he  taught  briefly  before  heading  to  Wall
Street; and
  WHEREAS,  As  he advanced from mail room to trading desk with increas-
ingly important roles, Kenneth D.  Pasternak's  quintessential  American
story  unfolded;  he  co-founded Knight Capital Group, a publicly traded
financial services company and  built  it  into  the  leading  wholesale
market maker in the United States securities markets; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1999, Kenneth D. Pasternak was named the Ernst and Young
Entrepreneur of the Year and later founded Chestnut Ridge Capital; and
  WHEREAS, Kenneth D. Pasternak is the son of Heinz and  the  late  Rose
Pasternak,  both  of  whom  set the standard for his tenacity and strong
work ethic; the elder Pasternak, who ran a business and also  served  as
Mayor  of  Fleischmanns,  was  instrumental in efforts to save Belleayre
Mountain in 1984; and
  WHEREAS, Kenneth D. Pasternak and his family still maintain a home  on
the  outskirts  of  Fleischmanns  and pursue local business interests in
addition to their global efforts; and
  WHEREAS, A partner in  the  long-reviewed  Belleayre  Resort  Project,
Kenneth  D.  Pasternak  sees  his  legacy  to the region in terms of the
area's ability to be viable and sustainable for those  who  continue  to
live and work here; and
  WHEREAS,  Kenneth  D.  Pasternak  has  been a generous donor to a wide
variety of causes and projects for more than a decade; while his largest
efforts have gone to community institutions with deep  roots  and  broad
missions,  projects  like  painting a church or fixing Burroughs Hall in
Roxbury have also benefited from his benevolent support; and
  WHEREAS, Moreover, the Margaretville Hospital as well as the Margaret-
ville Pavilion would not have been built without the strong  support  of
Kenneth  D.  Pasternak; the MARK Group, the Roxbury Arts Group and State
University of New York at New Paltz are some of the other  beneficiaries
of the Pasternak Family Foundation; and
  WHEREAS,  Kenneth  D.  Pasternak has also given generously through the
Crossroads Foundation, established with partners at Crossroads Ventures,

to support community endeavors  in  health,  arts,  culture,  education,
sports and youth activities; and
  WHEREAS,  A legendary philanthropist in the region, Kenneth D. Paster-
nak personifies the can-do spirit, warm generosity and  entrepreneurship
of the people of the Catskills; and
  WHEREAS,  With  him  throughout have been his wife, Dorothy, and their
three children, Sara, Daniel and Rachel, all of whom feel privileged  to
be a part of his life and rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense  of  this Legislative Body that those who
enhance the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown  a
long  and  sustained  commitment to excellence certainly have earned the
recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Kenneth  D.  Pasternak  upon  the  occasion of his designation as
recipient of the Spirit of the Catskills Award; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Kenneth D. Pasternak.
